definition: Song Jiang, a principal hero of the novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传
surname Song/the Song dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang

sentences.english: In the manor the squire told them that Song Jiang, head of the liangshan Marsh, had snatched his daughter away by force.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽說莊主太公說他的女兒被梁山泊首領宋江搶走。

sentences.english: Introduced to the warden wearing a Song Jiang Kui.
sentences.chinese: 戴監獄長把李逵引見給了宋江。

sentences.english: But grace SongJiangShu dont listen to the mother fathers.
sentences.chinese: 但是恩祖的媽媽宋江淑不聽。

sentences.english: Seeing that Li Kui did not believe him, Song Jiang asked him to search his house.
sentences.chinese: 眼看李逵不相信他，宋江問他搜索自己的家。

sentences.english: Li Kui told them what he had heard, which song Jiang strongly denied.
sentences.chinese: 李逵告訴他們他所聽到的，這宋江堅決否認。

sentences.english: Axes in hand, Li Kui charged across the hall towards Song Jiang.
sentences.chinese: 手斧，李逵被控向宋江整個大廳。

sentences.english: No wonder the sight of Li Kui Song Jiang to be a dead set with Song Jiang.
sentences.chinese: 難怪李逵一見到宋江就死心塌地的跟定了宋江。

sentences.english: No wonder the sight of Li Kui Song Jiang to be a dead set with Song Jiang.
sentences.chinese: 難怪李逵一見到宋江就死心塌地的跟定了宋江。

definition: Liangshan city and County in Jining 濟寧|济宁[Ji3 ning2], Shandong
Lin Chong, one of the Heroes of the Marsh in Water Margin
Li Kui, character in the novel Water Margin 水滸全傳|水浒全传[Shui3 hu3 quan2 zhuan4]
Wu Song, a heroic outlaw of Liangshan po 梁山泊 in the classic novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传, whose exploits including killing a tiger with his bare hands
Wu Yong, character of 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], nicknamed Resourceful Star 智多星[Zhi4 duo1 xing1]
Huang Xin, character in The Water Margin
Fang La
Wang Ying (character in the "Water Margin")
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty
edge of the water/shore or sea, lake or river/seashore
Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh by Shi Nai'an 施耐庵[Shi1 Nai4 an1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature
Shi Nai'an (1296-1371), author of Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
verse criticizing officials/satirical verse
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Zhao Kuangyin, personal name of founding Song emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 (927-976)
